description.narrative: The focus is on three key areas: 1) political empowerment; 2) economic empowerment 3) Making data available to support elaboration of a comprehensive national plan to address violence against women.

Output 1: 1. Political incubator established with relevant curricula and plan to pave the way for women to be better prepared for the following election and initiate public debate on women in leadership. 2. No. of Kuwaiti women who are interested to be political candidates or who were elected, engaged in existing regional forums and networks that support women’s political participation.
Output 2: No. of Kuwaiti private sector companies applying WEP.
Output 3: Data on legal frameworks and attitudes towards GE including VAW informs national policy and strategy on VAW.

comment.narrative:
Output 1: No political incubator in place, Some engagement from former female members of parliament in the UN Women Raedat network.
Output 2: Baseline 0
Output 3: No data available on VAW and attitudes towards it

"Output 1: 1. Political incubator training courses have been completed and Media Observatory Unit and Manual established 2. Workshops on women´s empowerment and gender mainstreaming conducted with the participation of media representatives, CSOs, NGOs, Influencers and students. 3. “Establish linkages with Raedat women's network” workshop conducted by regional Women Parliamentarians (South South Cooperation) conducted and networking strategy for WRSC established. 6 Kuwaiti women leaders joined Raedat network. 4. strategic and Governance structure, mobilization plan for WRSC established . A three-years Sustainability and Institutional Strategic Plan 2019-2021 developed. Validation discussions was conducted with national stakeholders of the public, private sectors and NGOs . 5. Gender and communication strategy developed 6. Media tools/outlets for the campaign relevant to the Kuwaiti context developed 7. Database in place and Manual developed
Output 2: 1. No. of Kuwaiti private sector companies applying WEP tripled in numbers to reach 25 companies. 2. Kuwait joins the global “Ring the Bell” initiative and organized the event at Stock-exchange to mark the International Women’s Day 2019 3. Media campaign promoting women’s empowerment is designed and implemented 2019 4. Study of Women in the Labour Force is completed. 5. Kuwait Women’s Day conducted to highlight Kuwaiti Women Achievements within New Kuwait 7 Pillars 6. SDG5 Regional Symposium on Challenges and Approaches conducted (South South Cooperation)
Output 3: 1. IMAGES survey undertaken launched and published internally only. 2. Gender and Justice Report is finalised and published internally only. 3. Fertility study undertaken and published internally only. 4. A conference on VAW is conducted in Kuwait with the participation of countries from the region"

GEWE was not acchieved as JPO intiative planned by UN Women has not been successful in obtaining applications from Kuwaiti students. Contribute to first national report on progress in implementation of SDG 5. this activity was not achieved due to the selected consultant's availability constraints.

"Output 1: 1. 30 women have increased capacity on leadership skills to run for public office 2. 30 women have increased capacity to advance in leadership positions in public service 3. Two of the trained candidates are thinking of running for elections 4. 50% of women trained expressed how impactful were the leadership training. 5. Around twenty trained women participated in the first roundtable discussions. Two of them expressed interest to run for elections 6. Governance structure in place 7. Outline of workplan is in place 8. Outline of developing courses with a sister university on GEWE 9. 10 students engaged in 2018 Output 2: 1. No. of Kuwaiti private sector companies applying WEP 2. Kuwait joins the global “Ring the Bell” initiative and organized the event at Stock-exchange to mark the International Women’s Day 2018 3. Workshop with private sector promoting uptake of WEPs is organized 4. Media campaign promoting women’s economic empowerment is designed and implemented 2018 5. Entrepreneurship study with focus on women developed 6. Training on Gender Responsive Budgeting is organized for relevant government representatives Output 3: 1. IMAGES survey undertaken and developed. 2. Report on legal frameworks and mapping of services prepared and validated 3. Gender and Justice Report is developed 4. Fertility study developed"

"Output1: 1. Increased capacity of 25 aspiring women political candidates and women in public sector on leadership, campaign management and public speaking. Increased understanding of 15 trained women on the Raedat Network and the examples of former MPs 1. Increased capacity of 60 aspiring women political candidates and women in public sector on leadership, campaign management and public speaking. 2. Increased understanding of 15 trained women on the Raedat Network and the examples of former MPs 3. Draft strategic and Governance structure, mobilization plan for Women Center for Research and Studies for further discussions with national stakeholders of the public, private sectors and NGOs. 4. Improved understanding of 25 media professionals and advocates on media and gender and how to produce gender sensitive media products
Output 2: 1. Kuwait joins the global WEPs with the endorsement of six private companies. 2. Study of Women in the Labour Force is initiated with data collection.
Output 3: 1. Availability of data on VAW in Kuwait with statistics for future studies and reports 2. A mapping of the laws and regulations in Kuwait is available with specific reference to any discriminatory acts against women"
